main event: A bright, round object was observed falling rapidly to the south over Richmond, California on 6 March 1953.
interesting points: The observation lasted approximately 30 seconds, and the object was described as having a short pointed fall.
Possible explanations listed include balloon, meteor, aircraft, and astronomical object.
There was insufficient data for evaluation of whether the sighting was a hoax.
The report suggests that it was a possible meteor sighting.
The observation took place at 1930 hours local time.
sighted object: bright, round object falling rapidly to the south
